data.text:
I feel bad writing this review but in our experience, this was not a 5 star hotel. Maybe the main lobby is since it's so well-kept but the actual rooms we stayed in (two in fact) needed some renovations/repairs badly. 

Overall - We must've picked a VERY slow time to go b/c the hotel is incredibly empty. It felt like a ghost town and kind of depressing. Some people would love this but it honestly just made us sad and felt like the employees were just incredibly bored. Though they did try to make the best of it and some of them were super friendly with trying to sell you their services (i.e. great massage that was inexpensive).

Location - This is not close to Naama Bay and you need to grab a taxi (there is no Uber available) for a 15 minute drive. We did that one day, so we can get the "beach vibes" we were hoping for. 

Beach - As many have said, the "beach" is non-existent. There is a wooden dock you can go on and dive into the Red Sea. Many took advantage of it for snorkeling, which did seem beautiful. 

Pools - This hotel has a massive amount of pools, which were almost all empty. I'm not much of a pool person, so I didn't take advantage of it.

Staff - Most of the staff were surprisingly surly though once you say hello first, they will smile at you. The staff during the breakfast buffet who cleaned and maintained the seating areas were very nice, but definitely not the cooks/chefs. The housecleaning staff was also very kind.

Food - On the first night, we arrived late and ordered room service (burger and pasta). Luckily it was inexpensive but not the most delicious. It was definitely fine but I wouldn't recommend room service. We only paid for the breakfast buffet and again, b/c the hotel was very empty, it seemed they only put out a small amount of food options, which was fine. I hate wasting food, so I get it. The breakfast options were fine for a continental spread of options though nothing notable. They do have someone making omelettes, so that's always a plus!

Rooms - Yikes! On the first night, we were placed in a room that was very dated (i.e. think 1970s Miami vibes) and had a very old bathroom. The shower had corroded hardware and the grout was not clean looking. There was also some strands of hair. I was horrified and asked the front desk for another room. Since it was late at night, they said they could only move us the next morning. The second room, was a few doors down and was more renovated than my 70s room. The hotel renovated the shower area and we were thankful to see it was clean. However, later that day, we noticed a foul smell near the toilet and there was water leaking somewhere on the wall though we couldn't figure out how/where it came from. There was just a random puddle of smelly water. We were too tired to keep complaining and honestly, was just happy that housecleaning cleaned it up daily. 

If we ever go back to Sharm, this hotel would not be the place we choose to go back to. I'm sure it had its glory days but now isn't it. I truly hope they make the necessary renovations to give new clients a better experience.
data.title: Not the right hotel for us...

data.text:
We had an incredible week at Jolie Ville Golf Resort.

The hotel, pools, grounds and beach are beautiful and very nicely done. 

The food was really good too and the staff couldn't do enough for you... We were treated so well. We loved the a la carte restaurant aswell

The hotel was very quiet (maybe 5% full) which was fine for us but sad for the hotel. 

The only downside for us is that the beds are very hard. They did swap us rooms and upgrade us to Royal but to be honest the bed was exactly the same mattress 

Lots of people like a firm bed so wouldn't be a problem, but I have hypermobility and really struggled to get comfy and my back suffered 

I did have a few Thai massages though... Which were incredible and sorted me right out! Brutal massage but honestly the most effective in terms of fixing pain that I've ever had! 

My partner played a bit of golf... It's not cheap and was also very quiet on the course. He said course was OK, could do with a bit of work. It's the only course in sharm though. 

We both really did love the hotel and we would love to go back, if only they had softer mattresses. 

Other than that it was just idyllic
data.title: Beautiful hotel, great food and incredible customer service and staff

data.text:
Itâ€™s big resort with bug rooms and very nice landscape , food quality is very good , staff are so helpful, only have comment on shower experience which  is not that good, they have small shower gun with limited water boundary and hanged in lower point which give worst shower experience not expected in 5 stars hotel, also the bathtub is so big for nothing, no jaquzi  jets included so wondered why that big bathtub
I think with few renovation this hotel will be of best
data.title: Big hotel and nice but final touch is messing

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Our honor to welcome you at our hotel, and always ready to host you at our home Golf Beach Resort 

Sorry for uncomfortable experience you had, and it would be great to leave your feedback during your stay as its very importin to change and improve whatever issues from negative to positive. 
Will be great to welcome you again to improve the best hospitably and service. 
Ones more thanks for your feedback
owner_response.author: Hotel Management

data.text: The rooms are dirty. Full of smoke and dust.  The AC sound is too high.  I keep being bitten by bugs.  The sheets smell incredibly bad. I am cutting my stay short as this is a huge sanitary risk even though I am here for work. On top of things the color schemes and coordination are an aberration for the eye.
data.title: Sanitary risk.

Assure you to have an investigation for whatever was mentioned on your review. 

Ones more thanks for your feedback
owner_response.author: Hotel Management

data.text:
Our third visit to the hotel and had another great experience.
Rooms are spacious and clean. soft pillows are available if you ask.
Bottled water left in room daily. also a free mini bar with soft drinks
Plenty of sun loungers around the pool.
Buffet style food excellent choice
Lebanese restaurant is also very good
Staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly.
Special thanks to Mohamed and Hamada at the main restaurant for looking after us so well. 
The hotel is in the process of having work done but this is non evasive.
Would certainly highly recommend
The best hotel we have stayed in in any resort in Egypt
Hope to return in October with our two young grandchildren.
data.title: great hotel. great stay
